item.title: Launch DigitalOcean droplet
item.description: Setup your SSH key on DigitalOcean How to do this in the DigitalOcean cloud console Login to the DigitalOcean cloud console. Click Settings in the menu. Click on the Security tab. Click on the Add SSH Key button. Paste your public SSH key into the box. (copy the contents of ~/.ssh/id_ed25519.pub.) Enter a key name, I recommend this be the same as the hostname of your raspberry pi. Finish adding the key, click Add SSH Key.

item.title: Configure the droplet on the Pi
item.description: You now need to be able to control the droplet’s root user from the Raspberry Pi’s pi user. Create a new SSH config entry for the sentry (replace sentry.example.com with your own droplet’s DNS name): Append to the SSH config on the Pi Run this on the Raspberry Pi cat <<EOF >> ~/.ssh/config Host sentry User root Hostname sentry.example.com ControlMaster auto ControlPersist yes ControlPath /tmp/ssh-%u-%r@%h:%p EOF Test the connection from the Pi to the sentry Run this on the Raspberry Pi ssh sentry whoami The first time you connect, you must confirm the host fingerprint (type yes):

item.title: Configure d.rymcg.tech for the sentry
item.description: Ensure you use the correct Docker context Run this on the Raspberry Pi d context use sentry Run the main config The main config must be run for each new context you create: (stdout) > This will make a configuration for the current docker context (sentry). Proceed?
